org.hibernate.ogm.options.spi

Interface OptionsContext

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    OptionsContextImpl

    public interface OptionsContext
    Provides access to the options effectively applying for a given element (e.g. a property or entity type). The following precedence rules apply in case an option is specified more than once at different levels:
    • Property-level options take precedence over entity-level options which take precedence over global options
    • On each level options specified via the API take precedence over options specified using annotations
    The algorithm for resolving option values is described more formally in the following. The algorithm aborts as soon as an option value has been found in any of its steps.

    Option value resolution algorithm

    1. If the given element represents a property,
      1. look for an option value configured on the property itself,
      2. iteratively repeat step 1.1. for super-class properties overridden by the given property, walking up the entire inheritance hierarchy beginning with the direct super-class of the entity-type hosting the given property.
    2. If the given element represents an entity type,
      1. look for an option value configured on the entity itself,
      2. iteratively repeat step 2.1 for the super-classes of the given entity type, walking up the entire inheritance hierarchy beginning with the entity type's direct super-class.
    3. Look for an option value configured via the programmatic API on the global level
    4. As measure of last resort, look for an option value specified via a configuration property in persistence.xml etc.
    Author:
    Gunnar Morling

      Returns the value of the option with the given identifier, if present.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        <I,V,O extends Option<I,V>> V get(Class<O> optionType,
                                I identifier)
        Returns the value of the option with the given identifier, if present. Note that for obtaining unique options preferably getUnique(Class) should be used.
        Type Parameters:
        I - the type of the option identifier
        V - the type of the option value
        O - the option type
        Parameters:
        optionType - the type of option to return the value of
        identifier - the identifier of the option to return the value of
        Returns:
        the value of the specified option or null if no value is present

      • getUnique

        <V,O extends UniqueOption<V>> V getUnique(Class<O> optionType)
        Returns the value of the unique option of the given type, if present.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of the option value
        O - the option type
        Parameters:
        optionType - the type of option to return
        Returns:
        the unique option with the given type or null if this option is not present

      • getAll

        <I,V,O extends Option<I,V>> Map<I,V> getAll(Class<O> optionType)
        Returns all values of the specified option type, keyed by identifier. Note that unique options should preferably be obtained via getUnique(Class).
        Type Parameters:
        I - the type of the option identifier
        V - the type of the option value
        O - the option type
        Parameters:
        optionType - the type of option to return
        Returns:
        a map with all values of the specified option, keyed by identifier. May be empty but never null
